messages.text: Hi there! Is this the right place to ask about Blink.jl?

elements.text: Hi there! Is this the right place to ask about Blink.jl?

messages.text: Before asking a ton of questions, I was wondering if someone could refer to a package or repo using Blink in a neither too simple nor too complicated way.

elements.text: Before asking a ton of questions, I was wondering if someone could refer to a package or repo using Blink in a neither too simple nor too complicated way.

messages.text:
My short term goal is to be able to reproduce this Electron tuto <https://dev.to/aurelkurtula/creating-a-text-editor-in-electron-reading-files-13b8> as a Blink.jl tuto
But my js is slightly rusty, so I would be happy to have a Blink.jl app that I could refer to help me understand some concepts :slightly_smiling_face:

attachments.title: Creating a text editor in Electron: part 1 - Reading files
attachments.text: creating a text editor with electron
attachments.fallback: DEV Community: Creating a text editor in Electron: part 1 - Reading files

as a Blink.jl tuto

messages.text:
Based on what I am reading here and there, it seems an approach is to mix several packages such as Blink, Observables, Interact, etc.
I know wonder from where to start

elements.text:
Based on what I am reading here and there, it seems an approach is to mix several packages such as Blink, Observables, Interact, etc.
I know wonder from where to start

messages.text: I wouldn’t recommend using Blink to build anything too terribly complex. Electron is a web technology and you’re gonna have a better time in JS land. Blink is the sweet spot for when you wanna create simple UI front ends for something in Julia (eg involving plots and sliders)

elements.text: I wouldn’t recommend using Blink to build anything too terribly complex. Electron is a web technology and you’re gonna have a better time in JS land. Blink is the sweet spot for when you wanna create simple UI front ends for something in Julia (eg involving plots and sliders)

messages.text:
I see. Actually, I want to make a GUI for StaticWebPages.jl, a static web pages generator I wrote in Julia. It is already almost Julia syntax agnostic, but I want to make it totally agnostic and more user friendly through a GUI. And I want it cross platform...
Blink looked like a good choice haha. But maybe I need to look for other GUI tools.
